flow.descriptionCdata:
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.0989ce9a-6a0b-4fa0-8733-cfe5dcb7bec0.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - the first value.
value2 - the second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.0fafb0cd-d08f-4119-a820-b274fc779f1e.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.159ff022-5430-4dae-8128-87ec831da680.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.2655178c-21ec-4ed8-b156-cf235f6a1b30.description=Sleeps for "X" seconds. 
Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for "X" seconds.
failure - was unable to sleep for some reason
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.5a210e89-8832-4324-ab34-2fc42bc895ba.description=Starts a full remediation on the specified server. If wait is specified, this operation will wait for the remediation to complete. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server to remediate. serverId - The ID of the server to remediate. If this input is provided, then the server name is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. 8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.8164600a-b55e-4e47-b2c2-52e50a8154b2.description=Assigns a patch policy to each server, device group or hypervisor contained in the list of attachable items. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. patchPolicyName - The name of the patch policy. patchPolicyID - The ID of the patch policy. If this input is provided, then patchPolicyName is ignored. attachableNames - A 'separator' separated list of server, device group or hypervisor names to which the patch policy will be attached. The elements of the list must be all of the same type. (e.g. names of servers) attachableIDs - A 'separator' separated list of server, device group or hypervisor IDs to which the patch policy will be attached. The elements of the list must be all of the same type. (e.g. ids of servers) attachableType - The type of the attachable items. Can be one of the following values\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data 8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.a785cbf3-1578-410e-81de-108ed11a748b.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - the first value.
value2 - the second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.abbf9401-6063-4606-b46e-14bc1127e48e.description=
Iterates through a list of values. Modifying the value of the list and delimiter inputs during iteration is not generally supported.

Inputs\:
list - The list to iterate through.
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list.

Returns\:
The current element of the list, if the response is has more

Responses\:
has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned.
has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list.
failure - failed to process the list.

Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously.

WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.d7cd090f-4c65-44a2-b65c-d5785a42d7da.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
count - number of loops to complete
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.d85fd995-ce65-4771-939e-1cabc1c63b35.description=Waits for the job to reach a specific state. If no state is specified, then this will wait for the job to reach an end state. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. jobID - the id of the job status - The status to wait for the job to reach. If none is specified this will wait until the job is no longer running. timeout - The maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the job. If not specified, 1 hour is used. Responses\: failure - Something went wrong. success - The operation completed successfully. 8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.d896e3aa-5691-438c-8ba9-130a944247bd.description=Starts a remediation on the given server using a set of attached/detached software policies. If the software policies information is not provided, then a full software policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server to remediate. serverId - The ID of the server to remediate. If provided, the server name is ignored. softwarePoliciesNames - The names of the software policies to remediate against (separated by comma). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. softwarePoliciesIDs - The IDs of the software policies to remediate against (separated by comma). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. If this input is provided, then 'softwarePoliciesNames' is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. 8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.description=
Duplicated from /MTC/Library/Providers/VPC/Subflows/SA/SA_Manual_Remediate flow to attach patch policies into a server and remediate those. 

Inputs\:

Hostname - hostname of the server known by SA e.g. FQDN
SoftwareList - list of Patch Policies to be attached and remediated separated by | e.g. Microsoft Patch MLOS w2k12R2 OS|Microsoft Patch MLOS w2k12R2 OS-30
server.rebootOption - SA reboot option e.g. at_end
sa.username - username to access SA
sa.password - password for the above username
8ebc59d9-5007-411f-b871-d07ecba737c5.e5334638-4145-4af0-aff6-6e844206baaf.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
flow.name: SA_Manual_Patch_Remediate

staticBinding.value: Microsoft Patch MLOS w2k12R2 OS|Microsoft Patch MLOS w2k12R2 OS-30
